definition: to sit for a makeup exam/to resit an exam/makeup exam/resit
to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father

sentences.english: Several students missed the exam and had to make it up.
sentences.chinese: 有幾個學生缺考，所以必須補考。

sentences.english: It can't be worse, Bill, cheating again in the make-up exam.
sentences.chinese: 沒什麼比這更糟的了，比爾，在補考的時候又作弊。

sentences.english: He has not resat since last term.
sentences.chinese: 自從上學期以來他就不曾補考過。

sentences.english: The retakes will be at beginning of the next term.
sentences.chinese: 補考將在下學期開始時進行。

sentences.english: A make-up test will be given on the day the student returns to school.
sentences.chinese: 若逢考試日，請於回校日參加補考。

sentences.english: When are you going to resit maths?
sentences.chinese: 你什麼時候去補考數學？

sentences.english: Keuka China Programs policies governing the comprehensive grade replacement exam and repeating a course will apply.
sentences.chinese: 補考將按庫克中國項目補考和重修政策執行。

sentences.english: Keuka China Programs policies governing the comprehensive grade replacement exam and repeating a course will apply.
sentences.chinese: 補考將按庫克中國項目補考和重修政策執行。

sentences.english: I give make-up tests on Fridays.
He retook the chemistry paper last week.
sentences.chinese: 她在上週補考了一次化學。

sentences.english: A:You'll have to take a make-up exam in logic.
Alan: Oh, we'll arrange supplementary exams when you return.
sentences.chinese: 等你回來之後我們會再爲你安排補考的。

sentences.english: If love can make-up, then I don't cheat.
sentences.chinese: 如果愛情，可以補考，那我不在作弊。

sentences.english: Then you must make them up, so that you get credit for the complete course.
sentences.chinese: 那你必須補考，這樣你纔算修完課程，得到學分。

sentences.english: I hear you have to re-sit your computing exam.
sentences.chinese: 據說你的計算機課程需要補考？

sentences.english: She managed to resit her exams and pick up her degree course.
sentences.chinese: 於是她盡力克服困難參加補考，重修學業。

definition: foundation of a University or College/school opening/the start of a new term
to repeat a year in school
variant of 復習|复习[fu4 xi2]
to try one's luck/to leave sth to chance
to sit for the second round of a two-stage exam
to make up missed lesson/to reschedule a class
